titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ لَوْ تَرَكَ النَّاسُ الْحَجَّ لَجَاءَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ
titles.en: Chapter 34 – It is such that if the people were to neglect the Hajj, the Punishment would come to them

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ لَيْسَ فِي تَرْكِ الْحَجِّ خِيَرَةٌ وَ أَنَّ مَنْ حُبِسَ عَنْهُ فَبِذَنْبٍ
titles.en: Chapter 33 – There is no goodness in neglecting the Hajj, and if one is withheld from it, so it is due to sin

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ لَوْ تَرَكَ النَّاسُ الْحَجَّ لَجَاءَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ
titles.en: Chapter 34 – It is such that if the people were to neglect the Hajj, the Punishment would come to them

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/154)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حُسَيْنٍ الْأَحْمَسِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَوْ تَرَكَ النَّاسُ الْحَجَّ لَمَا نُوظِرُوا الْعَذَابَ أَوْ قَالَ أُنْزِلَ عَلَيْهِمُ الْعَذَابُ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Husayn Al Ahmasy,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘If the people were to neglect the Hajj, they would not be Respited of the Punishment’, or said: ‘The Punishment would descend upon them’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Husayn af-Ahmasiy who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that if people neglect al-Hajj they will not be given any chance to avoid the coming of torment upon them, or that he said, ‘torment will come upon them/”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/154)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ

text: ذَكَرْتُ لِأَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) الْبَيْتَ فَقَالَ لَوْ عَطَّلُوهُ سَنَةً وَاحِدَةً لَمْ يُنَاظَرُوا .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Hanan Bin Sadeyr, from his father who said,
‘I mentioned the House (Kabah) to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If they were to suspend it for one year, they would not be (given the) Respite (from the Punishment)’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn Isma‘il from Hanan ibn Sadir from his father who has said the following: “I once mentioned the House before abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, and he said, ‘If people neglect it one year, they will not be given any chance to avoid the coming of torment upon them.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/154)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحَجَّالِ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: كَانَ عَلِيٌّ ( صلوات الله عليه ) يَقُولُ لِوُلْدِهِ يَا بَنِيَّ انْظُرُوا بَيْتَ رَبِّكُمْ فَلَا يَخْلُوَنَّ مِنْكُمْ فَلَا تُنَاظَرُوا .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Hajjal, from Hammad,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Ali<sup>asws</sup> was saying to his<sup>asws</sup> sons: ‘O my<sup>asws</sup> sons! Consider the House (Kabah) of your Lord<sup>azwj</sup>, so it should not be empty from you, and never have conflict (second thoughts) about (visiting it)’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Hajjal from Hammad who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that ’Amir al-Mu’minin would say to his sons, ‘My sons, take the House of your Lord in your consideration so it is not left without your presence therein; otherwise, you will risk coming of torment upon you.”’

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/154)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنْ فَضَالَةَ بْنِ أَيُّوبَ عَنْ أَبِي الْمَغْرَاءِ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يَزَالُ الدِّينُ قَائِماً مَا قَامَتِ الْكَعْبَةُ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Husayn Bin Saeed, from Fazalat Bin Ayoub, from Abu Al Magra, from Abu Baseer,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The Religion would not cease to be standing for as long as the Kabah is standing’.
en.sarwar: 4. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from al-Husayn ibn Sa‘id from Fadalah ibn Ayyub from abu al- Mighra’ from abu Basir who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that religion (al-Islam) will continue to exist as long as al-Ka‘bah is maintained.”
